ygData.subject: [ANN] First heritrix release, version 0.2.0.
ygData.msgSnippet: I just finished making our first release. Below I list what I did making the release.  Its got holes in it.  We can add to it as we get more practise

From: Michael Stack <stack@...>
Subject: [ANN] First heritrix release, version 0.2.0.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

I just finished making our first release. 

Below I list what I did making the release.  Its got holes in it.  We 
can add to it as we get more practise releasing.

St.Ack


MAKING A HERITRIX RELEASE
              
Before making a release, its assumed that the current HEAD version has 
been run through the (as yet non-existent) test suite to ensure HEAD is 
release worthy.

1. Send a mail to the list to stop commits until the all-clear is 
given.                                                              
2. Change the project.xml 'currentVersion' element (See "Version and 
Release Numbering" for guidance on what version number to use).
3. Get maven to generate a new build.xml file:
                                                                                

    % $MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven ant
                                                                                

4. Compare the newly generated build.xml to the one in cvs.  Patch the 
new file so it picks up the required modifications that are in CVS such 
as the adding of 'source="1.4"' to jar and javac producer targets, etc.
5. Make the maven distributions:
                                                                                

   % $MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven dist
                                                                                

6. Build the src version using both maven and ant.
7. Run both the binary and src-built product through the (as yet 
non-existent) test suite.
8. Update changes.xml.
9. Update the README.txt (Perhaps we should be copying the changes in 
here so they are available in the base of the heritrix bundle).
10. Tag the CVS repository:
   
    % cvs -q tag heritrix-?_?_?

11. Update the project.xml 'currentVersion' incrementing the version 
number beyond that of the release currently being made (If we're 
releasing 0.2.0, then increment to 0.3.0).
12. Login and upload the maven 'dist' product to sourceforge into the 
admin->File releases section.
13. Update news on website, send announcement to mailinglist -- and an 
all-clear that commits may resume -- and update our release state on 
freshmeat site (Here is the URL I used creating our freshmeat project: 
http://freshmeat.net/add-project/all-done/43820/46804/).
